TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/Button/CheckBox extends System.Object
public: ref class VisualStyleElement::Button::CheckBox abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Provides objects for the different states of the check box control. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Button.CheckBox> class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for a different state of the check box control.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Button.CheckBox> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElement_Button_CheckBox1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#14](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples/CS/Form1.cs#14)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#14](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples/VB/Form1.vb#14)]
